title: Ticket #5451: Gittrac: Add "Create derived ticket" link
description:
When looking at a ticket, on the line with "[Attach] [Edit] [History] [Rust]" there should be "[Create Derived]". Clicking it will take you to https://htcondor-wiki.cs.wisc.edu/index.cgi/tktnew?derived_from=3 , pre-filling in the "Derived From" field with the previous page's ticket number.

Bonus points for copying over Type, Subsystem, Customer Group, and Visibility.

Extra bonus points for noticing that the parent's summary has a colon, and copying everything up to and including the colon. So if you derive from "Ticket #5351: HTCondor View: replacement for Condor View", the new ticket's summary would be prefilled with "HTCondor View:"

Purpose, I've used derived tickets heavily for HTCondor View and the IPv6 work, and this is a slightly irritating wrinkle. It's easy to forget to set the derived field and it adds another step. Obviously not a big deal, but it would be nice.
